results.title: Sr. Director of Product (SaaS)
results.description:
Graphite is a digital marketing agency that builds scalable growth engines for consumer technology companies such as Ticketmaster, MasterClass, BetterUp, and Honey. We specialize in search engine optimization (SEO), content strategy, mobile app growth, and conversion optimization. We are a fully distributed team that is dedicated to creating an environment where you do the best work of your career. With headquarters in San Francisco and team members across the US, Canada, Latin America and Europe, we are ready to welcome our next team member!

We‚Äôre looking for our Sr. Director of Product (SaaS) to lead and manage product development from inception to production. The Sr. Director of Product (SaaS) will be responsible for leading the organization's product team and driving operational growth to ensure increased revenue and high-quality service delivery. In this role you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact in the company driving foundational product initiatives while bringing new ideas to the table and reporting directly to the CEO. This is a fully remote position.

¬†

What you‚Äôll do:

  • Design and execute a clear and measurable vision and strategy for our SaaS products that represents the future of the company
  • Drive the vision, strategy, and product roadmap for digital products
  • Manage products, projects, and processes while creating conducive conditions for driving product adoption and enhancing product experience
  • Collaborate with company leadership to align the product strategy and execute it collaboratively across departments
  • Lead the ideation, design, technical development, and launch of Graphite SaaS products
  • Obtain relevant customer and market data to guide and validate company direction on product development
  • Develop data-driven models and analytical approaches to determine business performance, growth, and emerging opportunities.
  • Be a subject matter expert on the platform and industry/competitive landscape while working with various product owners and validating team priority

What you‚Äôll need:

  • 8+ years of experience in B2B SaaS and product management required
  • Experience navigating executives, getting alignment, and driving key initiatives cross-functionally
  • Comfortable defining the necessary KPIs and metrics to measure success while possessing accountability
  • Master of communication possessing the ability to present complex concepts and analysis in a clear, succinct, and organized manner
  • Proven leadership experience with expertise in inspiring a team, and making key decisions in order to drive the company forward
  • Big picture thinker with the ability to define, align, and evangelize a product vision and strategy
  • Passionate about creating the best product solutions for your users
  • Propensity towards analyzing complex systems, workflows, and multiple user personas to create the best solutions
  • Curiosity; asking hard questions, corroborating assumptions, and leading the journey to achieving goals
  • Use data to inform key decisions by independently evaluating data from multiple sources across the organization
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple projects and deadlines
  • Proven track record of designing and executing marketing experiments that result in successful new marketing playbooks and strategies
  • Experience building products that use data and machine learning
  • Experience in SEO and paid acquisition is highly preferred

¬†

How we‚Äôll help

Graphite‚Äôs mission is to create an environment where you build the best work of your career. In order to facilitate this, we provide:

  • Process As Needed - We view the process as a way to empower better work, not as a series of dogmatic rules. We develop the best internal processes the same way we develop products - through iteration, measurement, and continuous improvement.
  • Autonomy - We trust you to be excellent at what you do. We will provide as much support as needed when needed, but no more. You will have autonomy and agency to drive projects forward, and own decisions and outcomes.
  • Flexible Work Environment - Everyone‚Äôs optimal work style is unique. We operate as a distributed team across the US, Canada, Latin America and Europe. We optimize for productivity and performance, not time spent in an office. Help us build an optimal work environment that fits you as an individual.
  • Compensation - We want to work with the best people in the World and compensate accordingly.
  • Vacation & Time Off - In order to be the best version of yourself, you need time to recharge. We offer flexible PTO. Take time when you need it.
  • Benefits - We will ensure you have quality health care coverage and opportunities to further your education.

Graphite provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected classification.

results.title: Product Designer
results.description:
About us

Electric vehicle sales are surging - over half of new cars sold as of 2030 globally are predicted to be electric. But one of the most challenging elements of owning an electric vehicle is its charging and that‚Äôs where we come in.

We set up in 2018 to make EV charging simple, green and low cost for drivers, to encourage EV adoption and reduce carbon emissions from transport. Core to our platform is a proprietary smart-charging algorithm, dynamically aligning charging with intermittent low-carbon electricity, reducing carbon emissions from grid electricity by as much as 70%. We've so far secured over 13 million USD in funding, have over 100k drivers using our app, and were named 'Best Energy Startup in the World' when we won the Free Electrons programme.

To achieve all of this, we gathered a great team bringing expertise from their previous roles at National Grid, Bulb, BBOX, Powervault, BCG, Starling, and more. We're now over 70 people working fully remotely across Europe and North America, and pride ourselves on our inclusive and collaborative culture.

We're aiming to have over a million drivers using our product, and we're looking for even more talented and passionate folk to join our mission.

The role

Our Driver team is looking for a hands-on, self-motivated Product Designer to work on our solar product.

¬†

We‚Äôve developed our solar feature to the point of MVP stage - we‚Äôre now ready to progress to full development and feature expansion. Launching this product will forge new partnerships that will help us reach hundreds of thousands of customers. This is an exciting time to join a small but rapidly growing team where you will have the opportunity to be involved in all aspects of the product development process.

¬†

As our Product Designer, you will be responsible for designing and prototyping new user experiences based on product requirements. Deliverables include design mockups, prototyping, production of visual assets and importantly, the documentation required for proper implementation.

¬†

As a key part of our design team you‚Äôll flourish in a dynamic start-up environment and adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. You‚Äôll be a natural collaborator and an excellent communicator.

¬†

You have a keen eye for details and aesthetics, but your strengths lie in distilling complex issues and data, breaking them down into iterations and translating them into clean, simple solutions. You must be a self-starter, able to work independently and perform multiple tasks under minimal supervision.

What will you do?¬†

Design and ship new features end-to-end and drive product improvements
Tackle ambiguous design problems
Work cross-functionally with product managers, engineers and your design peers
Create, collaborate and iterate on design work, from concept to high-fidelity
Translate data-heavy screens into user-friendly interactions
Build a product that our users love¬†

¬†

What are we looking for?

A strong command of visual and communication design principles
Fluid written and spoken English, to collaborate with peers across the company
Confidence and skill with Figma, our main design tool
Ability to design app experiences from start to finish
Familiarity with the product development process
Clear and careful annotation skills¬†

¬†

We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you:

Are highly logical, detail-oriented and actively demonstrate that you care about great usability
Are able to function independently and in a team, with excellent collaboration skills
Consider research and validation a key part of product design
Have worked with highly technical products in previous roles
Have an interest in sustainability, green tech or electric vehicle
Have worked with cross-functional teams of engineers and product managers in the past¬†

You don‚Äôt need to:

Be a master at every design discipline and tool ever invented
Have a website - PDF‚Äôs or notion pages with case studies including process breakdowns and impact of your work will be fine
Have a professional qualification
Know how to code (but knowing how developers work is key)¬†

Have a specific number of years of experience - but you should be able to demonstrate real-world experience with cross-functional teams building complex products¬†

¬†

If you‚Äôre excited about our company and the role but you feel you don‚Äôt match the points above perfectly, we still hope you‚Äôll apply as soon as possible so we can consider your application!

¬†

Your application will not be considered without a portfolio/case study and CV.

How will we support you?
  • Remote working, investing in your home office setup or a co-working location convenient for you
  • Access to conferences, meet-ups and training
  • A top of the range Macbook Pro and all you need to do your best work
  • A structured career progression framework and advancement opportunities
  • Fully-loaded benefits including health, dental, vision, life and 401(k)
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous equity in the company, with options to earn more shares as you progress
  • Quarterly team meet-ups, to collaborate and have fun in person!

If you don‚Äôt have all of the requirements but you‚Äôre really interested in what we‚Äôre doing, please apply anyway! We‚Äôd love to hear from you and may be able to tailor the role around your abilities and experience. We value applicants regardless of their background or years of experience.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.¬†

We have a transparent salary and progression framework. The salary range is ¬£53,000 - ¬£69,000 depending on how we assess you against our framework during interviews.

  • 3+ years of financial systems experience

We're on a mission to change health care -- an experience made whole by our unique backgrounds and perspectives..

Full-time employees are eligible for benefits including: medical, dental, and vision benefits, paid holidays, paid vacation and sick time, paid parental leave, 401(k) plan participation, life and disability insurance, and paid wellness time and reimbursements.

results.title: Research Team Coordinator - Contest Every Race
results.description:
Help make sure no Republican gets a free pass into office!

Every year, hundreds of thousands of elections for public office go uncontested nationwide. Contest Every Race, a project incubated within Movement Labs, recruits regular people with good values to run for office in red and purple states, so we compete everywhere while building the Dem bench and helping get out the vote.

We're hiring a Political Research Team Coordinator to lead and drive our research projects, complete research on upcoming elections, incumbents, and candidates, and compile information on qualifications and filing requirements. You‚Äôll lead a team of passionate volunteers who search online and make hundreds of phone calls to county and municipal election officials. You‚Äôll also coordinate with our data and operations teams to turn our research into results, helping our prospective candidates succeed in filing to run for office.

This job is a great way to make a real difference in American politics from anywhere in the US. We've recruited over 5000 candidates and plan to double our impact in the coming years. You can grow with us as a key member of a small, distributed team, led by people with high-level experience.


Responsibilities
  • Complete research projects with an eye for accuracy and timeliness, and become a subject matter expert in the states you manage
  • Manage interns and volunteers doing day-to-day research operations, completing quality checks and up-skilling researchers along the way
  • Train and engage new researchers, and encourage lasting relationships with them
  • Operationalize plans for volunteer recruitment and retention in accordance with our team needs and volume of work

Requirements

  • Systematic in your approach, independently motivated, and driven toward efficiency
  • Detail-oriented and meticulous
  • Skilled with finding and verifying information online, reading government notices and documents, and articulating information requests via email and phone in a polite and professional manner
  • Comfortable with sometimes repetitive and/or challenging research tasks
  • Attentive and flexible with competing priorities while maintaining a high quality of work
  • Passionate about politics, local government, civic engagement, and beating back fascism

Benefits

The salary range for this position is $50,000 - $55,000, commensurate with experience. Movement Labs employees receive excellent health, dental, and vision benefits, access to a 401K account, work-from-home stipends, and unlimited Paid Time Off.

Employees are represented by the IBEW.

results.title: Marketing Operations Manager
results.description:
ABOUT US

¬†

Sorted is a refreshingly agile and data-driven software company, powering dynamic checkouts, carrier management, delivery tracking and automating returns management around the world. Through partnerships with some of the biggest global carriers and customer-obsessed retailers, Sorted transforms every delivery journey into a 5* customer experience.

Trusted by leading global retailers ‚Äì such as ASOS, Asda and Lush ‚Äì Sorted‚Äôs delivery experience platform fixes poor delivery choice, broken customer promises and disjointed post-purchase communication to increase customer happiness, drive loyalty and support retail growth

With software now live in 17 countries, Sorted is recognised as one of fastest growing companies in Europe as named by the FT and one of the UK‚Äôs most successful digital businesses by Tech Nation‚Äôs Future Fifty, Europe‚Äôs leading late-stage growth programme.

We‚Äôre very ambitions with a brilliant team of over 100 talented people.

Our values guide our decisions, the way we work, our culture and the people we ask to join the team. We work hard, have fun and are united as a team when it comes to driving transformation forward ‚Äì not just for our business, but transformation for the retail tech industry.

We‚Äôre not afraid to make mistakes (we‚Äôd never learn if we didn‚Äôt) and we‚Äôre always looking to challenge ourselves. Our style is collaboration based on honesty, transparency and looking forward.

We‚Äôre working hard to make Sorted great; we know the roller coaster will continue but, with great people and an exciting roadmap in place, now is the time to be part of our story.

If you‚Äôre inspired by what we‚Äôre doing, are up for a challenge and share our vision, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

¬†

¬†

ABOUT THE ROLE

Reporting to the VP Marketing & Product Management, the Marketing Operations Manager is central to ensuring marketing programs run seamlessly through the delivery and optimisation of all marketing processes. You will own and develop the marketing technology stack, ensuring all platforms and tools in use support excellence in prospect and customer engagement and marketing best practice. You will also own and develop all marketing team reporting, tracking, retrospectives and performance insight, helping the team understand performance of campaigns and performance against pipeline goals.

¬†

The day-to-day stuff:

No two days are ever the same at Sorted so what you‚Äôll be up to will vary. The pace we move at also means priorities will change and you‚Äôll need to be comfortable with this (we‚Äôll support you!). But these are the things that will be core to your role and will keep you busy.

  • Produce weekly, monthly and quarterly performance dashboards that drive a culture of continuous improvement, tracking campaign performance, performance vs pipeline goals, identifying gaps and using insight to make recommendations for remediation.
  • Champion use of our marketing automation platform, ensure democratisation of use across the marketing team by providing access to learning and coaching materials
  • Own the planning, execution and optimisation of email nurture programs within Hubspot and Salesloft
  • Budget responsibility for all platform and subscription spend.
  • Produce monthly board pack and business performance update
  • Own prospect database, ensuring data capture across the funnel is aligned with our ICP and Market segmentation model. Ensure sales and marketing teams are clear and coached on data best practice in line with GDPR policy.
  • Working with Marketing and Sales colleagues, continuously review the martech and salestech markets for solutions that will help us achieve our commercial goals; including but not limited to; Live-Chat, Sales Outreach, Sales Enablement, Data Enhancement.
  • Ensure CRM and Marketing Automation platforms are structured to support key lead to revenue processes and reporting
  • Work closely with sales operations to ensure data is syncing seamlessly in Salesforce, Hubspot, Salesloft and Demandbase.
  • Provide ad-hoc reporting to VP Marketing & Product Management and Exec team as required.
  • Ensure a library of lead to revenue process documentation is maintained
  • Ensure marketing, sales, customer success and finance teams are aligned with all systemic operational changes across the lead to revenue process.
  • Responsible for system administration and managing multiple integrations across the martech stack
  • Assist new starters with onboarding to ensure they are set up with the appropriate configuration across all platforms

Requirements

ABOUT YOU

  • Must have demonstrable experience owning and developing marketing automation and CRM platform use in B2B organisations.
  • Must be an advanced user of Salesforce and Hubspot.
  • Must be highly inquisitive, able to provide meaningful insights in data that drive performance optimisation recommendations.
  • Must be a natural problem solver, able to interpret business challenges and apply process and systemic solutions.
  • Must be in tune with B2B (particularly SaaS) Marketing and Sales best practice.
  • Must be comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets, manipulating them to deliver meaningful outputs.

And it would be super great if you had:

  • Experience syncing, running, and optimising Demandbase and Salesloft within a B2B marketing operation.
  • You know what it‚Äôs like to work in a scale up company and love the vibe (and sometimes chaos!).

Benefits

WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE WORKING HERE:

Aside from the role, the people, our culture and our mission, we have some other things that make Sorted a pretty awesome place to be. Here‚Äôs a few other things that our people love:

  • Share our success: We know our success is a credit to our talented and hard-working people, so every Sorted employee has share options.
  • Generous holiday allowance: How does 40 days per year sound? How about an extra day for your birthday also? You got it!
  • Work isn‚Äôt somewhere where you go, it is something that you do: Our roles are remote-first (within the UK), but our Manchester and London offices are always free, should you ever want to pop in for a day, a meeting, or a drink.
  • Develop with Sorted: your development is our priority. Have a goal in mind? Share it with us and let us help you achieve it. On top of our ongoing training programmes, you can use your ¬£200 annual development fund on any training courses of your choice. We guarantee you‚Äôll learn loads, and develop both personally and professionally at Sorted too.
  • Your well-being matters: Private Health for everyone that works here including optical and dental cover. We also give you Life Assurance, and everyone has access to our employee assistance programme.
  • Supporting your family: We offer qualifying Sorted employees of all genders a generous 20 weeks of fully paid time off to look after their new arrivals.
  • Pension: We match pension contributions up to 5%
  • Our team: we‚Äôre an energetic, sociable and talented bunch who are super passionate about what we do and determined to make a difference. We‚Äôre all in it together, we learn from each other, we‚Äôre genuine and we don‚Äôt have time for politics

Sorted wants applicants from all backgrounds and walks of life, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive environment. If there is anything you need to help you participate fully in the interview process, we'd like to hear about that too, please just include it in your application.

Come join us!

results.title: Cyber Security Analyst
results.description:
¬†
HUMAN was founded in 2012 in a Brooklyn sci-fi bookstore by Tamer Hassan, Michael Tiffany, Dan Kaminsky, and Ash Kalb. Our humble beginnings led to the creation of the Human Verification Engine, the backbone of all our products that protect enterprises from sophisticated bots. Today we verify the humanity of more than 10 trillion interactions per week for some of the largest companies and internet platforms across the internet.¬†
¬†
Our hacker roots still permeate everything we do. You will be a part of the HUMAN front line in our commitment to helping protect companies (and in turn, their customers) from both revenue and reputation risk caused by malicious bots. However, HUMAN is not the center of this story. Humans like yourself are. We firmly believe in putting people first. This approach spans our extensive benefits and day-to-day culture in order for every human to do the best work of their life. We want to hear about the marathon you‚Äôre training for. We want to see pictures of your pets. We want to know your favorite robot (we have many).¬†
¬†
Even if you‚Äôre not a conventional ‚Äúhacker‚Äù we can assure you that you are a hacker in your own right. We want to work with people like you who break down problems to build up better solutions. That‚Äôs what makes us HUMAN.¬†¬†
¬†
You‚Äôll be joining us at an exciting moment in the HUMAN story: we joined forces with PerimeterX in a market-changing merger. Together under the HUMAN brand, we will disrupt the economics of cybercrime. We hope you can join us in that mission.
¬†



What you'll do:
  • Support customers (Tier 2) in real-time and provide professional technical responses.
  • Analyze customers‚Äô traffic to identify undetected threats and false detections using mostly ElasticSearch and BigQuery (SQL).
  • Work side by side with customers providing insightful incident reports.
  • Communicate with global customers and provide quick responses and resolutions.
  • Work cross-functionally with RnD and Research teams to optimize HUMAN‚Äô's ability to detect and mitigate real-time Cyber Attacks.
  • Design, plan and implement projects and automation for internal use.
  • Hold shifts as part of the job (including weekend shifts).



Who you are:
  • Perfect English, excellent customer-facing, and communication skills (a must!)
  • Analytical mindset and data driven decision making.
  • Passionate about data, security, and customer services.
  • Hands-on experience (1+ year) with data analysis of large and complex data sets (data manipulation, statistical analysis, conclusions, etc.)
  • Knowledge of web architecture and protocols (CDN, HTML, DOM, JS, HTTP, HTTPS, IPv4/v6, etc.)
  • Understanding of the cybersecurity threat landscape.
  • SQL and Javascript Proficiency.
  • B.A/B.S in related domains.
  • Able to work in Eastern Time Zone.
¬†
Life at HUMAN:
HUMAN prides itself on being an equal opportunity workplace. We firmly believe in putting people first regardless of who you are, where you come from, how you identify, or who your favorite robot is (we have many). We are on a mission to protect the integrity of the internet for everyone, so we welcome all individuals to come to share their unique experiences and perspectives as we fight against cybercrime together!
¬†
With Humans located in all parts of the world, we‚Äôve fully embraced our diversity of thought and are always looking for innovative ways to connect with one another - even in virtual reality! Although New York City is our HQ, with teams in London, Virginia, and Victoria, we trust our Humans in choosing where they work and how they work. The benefits package we provide reflects our remote-first culture and our commitment to our Humans‚Äô personal career development, which includes annual stipends for home office setup, wellbeing, and learning & development. We also offer weekly lunches, flexible time off, no-meeting Fridays, HUMAN days, sabbatical programs, and so much more.
¬†
We‚Äôre constantly trying to anticipate the needs of our Humans to ensure each one of us is equally prepared to do some of the best work of our life. Taking care of one another is part of the HUMAN experience and how we build true HUMAN connections.
¬†
If you are an individual with a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us directly.
¬†
Salary Range: $75k-$85k/yr
¬†
¬†

results.title: Mobile Developer
results.description:
Planning Center is a product company that is owned and founded by a developer. The Mobile Engineering Team is looking for a developer to join us in building powerful mobile applications that support churches in their day-to-day ministry work.

Reporting to the Engineering Manager of the Mobile Engineering Team, you will join the team in maintaining and expanding our flagship mobile products.

We‚Äôre a fully remote company that relies on tools such as GitHub, Slack, Notion, and Zoom. We value asynchronous work while also encouraging pairing to shape work and/or tackle the harder problems. We meet together in person about 4 times a year in our main offices in Carlsbad, CA to continue fostering better working relationships.


Pay & Benefits

We love our team. It‚Äôs one of the core pillars we work off of every day. Which is why we take care of you as best we can. Here‚Äôs a few highlights, but you can find all of our benefits here.

Get Paid‚ÄîWe pay in the top 10% of the New York City Rates no matter where you live, contribute to 401k, match charity up to $2,000 a year, and have generous allowance for continued education. The annual salary range for this position is $138,000‚Äì$178,000.

Be Healthy‚Äî100% remote, co-working stipend, generous paid sick time and vacation time, $200 a month for physical fitness and mental health, 95% medical & 100% dental premium health coverage.

Get Out‚ÄîPaid Fridays off in the summer, every other Friday off the rest of the year, a month long sabbatical every 5 years, one week off a year to serve with a non-profit, 2 weeks vacation a year increasing to 3 over time.


About You

The long haul‚ÄîWe hope you stay at Planning Center for as long as you‚Äôre able. This makes our code, processes, and support focused on scalability, longevity, teamwork, and humility.

No Ego, Amigo‚ÄîPlanning Center is full of incredibly talented people who work hard and love what they do. But, more importantly, we love working as a team. We encourage pairing, team work, and a healthy PR culture. There‚Äôs no room for rockstars here.

The ideal candidate for our Mobile Engineering team has several years of experience with a deep understanding of React Native, Android development, and object-oriented programming. You‚Äôll be taking on projects that touch our admin and congregant facing React Native and native applications. You‚Äôll help our team ensure we build in a way that scales as our user features change and app installs grow.


About the work

We are heavily invested in React Native, Java, Kotlin, Objective-C, and Swift. We don‚Äôt have titles that erect boundaries between front-end development and back-end development, so there are plenty of opportunities to learn across the entire stack. You‚Äôll encounter a fair mix of building new features from start to finish, refining existing features, improving performance, and ensuring the security of our customers‚Äô data.

Some tasks you will work on:

  • Translating a feature pitch into technical specifications
  • Implementing those technical specifications as a series of small GitHub pull requests
  • Pairing with designers and developer teammates
  • Reviewing your teammates‚Äô pull requests to increase the quality of what we build and learn from one another
  • Preparing code for mobile builds and releases on the Apple App Store, Google Play, and the Amazon Appstore
  • Iterating on the tools used for automated application build and release
  • Helping research and guide the team in the strategic use of 3rd party libraries and tools across mobile products
  • Staying on top of the constantly changing mobile features available and evaluating what upcoming features can be utilized help improve the user experience for our mobile applications
  • Investigating customer reported bugs that have been triaged and researched by our amazing support team
  • Diagnosing errors that come in through our error monitoring tools
  • Improving performance guided by Firebase Crashlytics, Bugsnag, and native IDE performance monitoring tools
  • Participating in book and code clubs to learn with/from other developers

Requirements

  1. Must reside and be eligible to work in the United States
  2. Must be willing to travel four times each year to connect with the rest of the team (not during a pandemic)

The Hiring Process

During the hiring process you‚Äôll have a chance to interact with several members of our team. We strongly encourage you to bring any questions you have to anybody you interact with. You‚Äôre interviewing us as much as we‚Äôre interviewing you.

The teammates you‚Äôll encounter along the way:

  • The engineering manager you‚Äôll be reporting to
  • One or more developers from the team you‚Äôll be joining
  • Developers from other teams within the company
  • Members of our executive team

Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. We‚Äôll respond to applications as they arrive, usually within a few days. Below is an outline of the steps in our hiring process.

  • Step one: Initial phone call with the team‚Äôs product manager for you to get to know us
  • Step two: An online coding assessment to get a rough understanding of your experience
  • Step three: Team interview over Zoom with the team‚Äôs product manager and a few developers
  • Step four: Technical interview over Zoom with a few developers
  • Step five: Meeting with our executive team and offer extended


Apply with a resume and a cover letter. Your cover letter should speak directly to this position. We want to know what got you into software development, how your experience has set you up for success in this role, and why you want to join our team. If you‚Äôve applied in the past, feel free to apply again.

results.title: Head of Marketing
results.description:
At Solar monkey we love making an impact by accelerating the transition to solar energy. We do this by giving solar installers super powers with our innovative software. This allows them to work much more effectively and install even more solar installations. With our software installers can easily design, sell and maintain solar power systems remotely. We are active in 3 countries and are about to expand our horizon internationally. We have seen the Dutch market grow x5 within 5 years and are ready to see the same impact in the rest of Europe!

¬†

The role of marketing is becoming increasingly important. Especially in new markets we need to start from scratch with very little brand awareness. To grow quickly we need to stir up the market, tell our story in appealing ways and attract the success we are looking for!

¬†

About the job:

Marketing is about telling the story of Solar Monkey. And we have some great stories to tell!

Your tasks and responsibilities will entail:

  • As head of marketing you are ultimately responsible for making sure that our stories get told with as much impact as possible. One key metric of course is the direct number of leads generated (SQL/MQL). But we see marketing much broader than just leads. Along the customer journey marketing is responsible for consistent story telling, helping our sales team to increase sales conversion and close more deals. Also marketing has a role for spreading the word helping us to gather job applicants or business partners. We believe there is much hidden value in just being out there and positioning ourselves as an authority in the market.

  • Although marketing is about storytelling, we aim to measure every single step in the process. You are responsible for making sure that every step can be measured and that this is done in a structured way. Using these insights you run an improvement cycle to continuously optimise our impact. We need to know the results and ROI of each campaign so we know what to scale up and what to scale down. Continuous experimentation and measuring results will help to find better ways.

  • You will lead the Marketing team at Solar Monkey. This is currently only 2 FTE, but we envision to grow to >5 FTE internally within a year. We also work with marketing agency Happy Horizon and a number of freelancers such as international copywriters. All will fall under your responsibility. You report directly to Jan Pieter, the CEO.

  • Which channels we use to expose our stories? Of course we have our own website that needs to be optimised on SEO and conversion. We use social media channels to increase exposure and generate traffic and leads. We advertise on Google, Linked in and through partners. And when we have something cool to share we make sure to connect with the press to help spread our message.

  • You keep abreast of what's going on in the market and incorporate it into marketing campaigns. SO you need to gain sufficient market insights to know what is intersting to share, and how to best reach our target audiences.

  • Also internally you are the face of marketing. You gather interesting stories from your colleagues and keep everyone updated on how we communicate with the outside world.

What's in it for you.

  • On top of the salary: Stock Appreciation Rights.

  • A training budget of 4% of your annual salary.

  • A Macbook

  • A challenging journey within an ambitious scale-up. Tons of responsibility and a good bunch of people to celebrate successes with.

  • Remote and Hybrid friendly culture. The flexibility to work where and when it fits you best and a budget to set up your workspace at home.

  • Monthly social events and quarterly strategy days (company wide events also for remote workers). Enough opportunity to have fun with your colleagues ;)

Where will you be doing this?

Our headquarters is in The Hague, and many creative ideas are best generated in real life collaboration. So it is useful if you can be at the office at least 1-2 days per week. We do have a remote friendly culture and in fact almost half the company works remote. So you will enjoy lots of freedom on where and when to do your work.

Who are we looking for?

  • Someone who is performance driven but who understands that health and wellbeing are a prerequisite for performing.

  • You have experience with SaaS and B2B marketing

  • You are creative and love to try new things. You are eager to learn and see failure as an opportunity, not something to be prevented.

  • You know how to set up a customer journey, measure all steps in the process and how to optimise results of each step.

  • Experienced in leading a team. The team is not super large, so we are not looking for a typical ‚Äòmanager‚Äô, more a pragmatic entrepreneurial type who gets things done with the team.

  • We want you to focus your storytelling on people. We love the personal touch and want you to engage with clients to really learn what they are up to. So you need to be outgoing enough to engage with them, rather than just working digital only.

  • Storytelling, copywriting should be one of your skills. You should be fluent in English. Dutch is nice to have. We can work around language skills through local copy writers. We will be active in 5 languages so it‚Äôs impossible for you to speak them all ;)

  • You should know how to visualise stories for maximum impact. Some skills in doing this yourself is useful.

  • You are located in the Netherlands.¬†

  • You are fluent in Dutch and English, Spanish, German, or French is a pre.

In order to have acquired those skills we think you would need 6+ years of experience in marketing. But to be honest, we don‚Äôt look much at resumes and would rather have you prove to use that you possess the required skills.

results.title: Data Engineer (scientific)
results.description:
Who We Are

TetraScience is the Scientific Data Cloud company with a mission to accelerate scientific discovery and improve and extend human life. The Scientific Data Cloud is the only open, cloud-native platform purpose-built for science that connects lab instruments, informatics software, and data apps across the biopharma value chain and delivers the foundation of harmonized, actionable scientific data necessary to transform raw data into accelerated and improved scientific outcomes. Through the Tetra Partner Network, market-leading vendors access the power of our cloud to help customers maximize the value of their data.

Our core values are designed to guide our behaviors, actions, and decisions such that we operate as one. We are looking to add individuals to our team that demonstrate the following values:

  • Transparency and Context- We trust our people will make the right decisions and overcome any challenges when given data and context.
  • Trust and Collaboration- We believe there can only be trust when there is transparency. We are committed to always communicating openly and honestly.
  • Fearlessness and Resilience- We proactively run toward challenges of all types. We embrace uncertainty and we take calculated risks.
  • Alignment with Customers- We are completely committed to ensuring our customers and partners achieve their missions and treat them with respect and humility.
  • Commitment to Craft- We are passionate missionaries. We sweat the details, as the small things enable the big things.
  • Equality of Opportunity- We seek out the best of the best regardless of gender, ethnicity, race, or age. We seek out those who embody our common values but bring unique and invaluable perspectives, talents and advantages.

What You Will Do

The TetraScience Professional Services Data Science Engineer will report into the Professional Services organization and will be responsible for the implementation of the TetraScience Data Platform for new clients. This entails execution on the project scope to ensure TetraScience meets or exceeds client expectations and fulfills their requirements.

Additional duties include research and prototype of data acquisition strategies for scientific lab instrumentation along with file parsers for instrument output files (.xlsx, .pdf, .txt, .raw, .fid, many other vendor binaries). Based on project scope, design and build data models, Python data pipelines, unit tests, integration tests and utility functions. As needed, build visualization, report, and dashboards using Spotfire, Tableau and Jupyter notebook for new clients.

Requirements

What You Have Done

  • 2+ years‚Äô experience working with in Python and SQL.
  • AWS/GCP/Azure certification desired.
  • Elasticsearch, science background, or experience with scientific instruments desired
  • Experience with tools like Spotfire, Tableau, Jupyter notebook (any of them) desired
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills; ability to explain technical information in non-technical language to drive progress.
  • Ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects, proactive troubleshooting skills and attention to detail.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Chemistry, Business or related field‚Äô or equivalent work experience

Ideal if you have

  • Passion about science and building solutions to make the data more accessible to the end-users.
  • Intellectually curious: Unwavering drive to learn and know more every day.
  • Ability to think creatively on how to solve project risks without reducing quality.
  • Ability to distill and present complex information to a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Team player and ability to "roll up your sleeves" and do what it takes to make the team successful.

Benefits

  • 100% employer-paid benefits for all eligible employees and immediate family members.
  • Unlimited paid time off (PTO).
  • 401K.
  • Flexible working arrangements - Remote work + office as needed.
  • Company paid Life Insurance, LTD/STD.
